title: jstransform dependency mismatch: esprima-fb
body:
I've been having issues installing `react` as of today. I've been using:
- react `0.12.2`
-  node `0.10.35` 
- switched between using `npm` at version `1.4.28` and `2.1.17`
- performed an npm cache clear

When I try to start my app, I get:

```
jstransform dependency mismatch: esprima-fb from /test_app/node_modules/react/node_modules/envify/node_modules/jstransform/node_modules/esprima-fb (expected: ~7001.0001.0000-dev-harmony-fb, got: 7001.1.0-dev-harmony-fb)
```

It seems that the leading 0s on the version numbers are being truncated as when I check the `version` field in the `package.json` of `esprima-fb`, it reads:

`7001.1.0-dev-harmony-fb`

I'm unsure if this is an `npm` registry issue or not, but was wondering if anyone had any insight into how to fix the issue (as I've spent many hours trying to get this to work).

Edit:

Also tried

``` bash
$ npm cache clean
$ npm cache add esprima-fb@7001.0001.0000-dev-harmony-fb
$ npm cache ls esprima-fb
~/.npm/esprima-fb/esprima-fb/
~/.npm/esprima-fb/esprima-fb/7001.1.0-dev-harmony-fb/
~/.npm/esprima-fb/esprima-fb/7001.1.0-dev-harmony-fb/package/
~/.npm/esprima-fb/esprima-fb/7001.1.0-dev-harmony-fb/package.tgz
~/.npm/esprima-fb/esprima-fb/7001.1.0-dev-harmony-fb/package/package.json
```
